instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_P: What is CHGR_CSI_P? CHGR_CSI_P is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_P and CHGR_CSI_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.[/PLAIN]

Hello and Merry Christmas to everyone :)

when shorting the power pads, the fan will spin for 1 sec then stop. But when i shorting the power pads for 5sec+ then it can turn on fine.
ASD EFI and OS passed all tests. i replaced the <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> even wasn't at fault.

board is not liquid damage. cant see any corrosion under microscope,

<RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> is fine

when i plug the keyboard flex back in, i am not able to perform SMC reset (Magsafe + Left Shift + Control + Option + Power )

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> measured at 3.4v and drop low to 0.3v when i press power.

charging the battery is fine. does same problem when i i use battery power only.
My 85w charger is REAL and i also have tried another 85w charger.


#Edit, can a mod fix my thread title.

cheers!
Alan

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: Sense resistor issues. Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 and traces to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message:
hi Duke

<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10.5ohm
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 10.5ohm
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 10.5ohm
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> 10.5ohm

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>'s <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_N</SIGNAL> is out putting 16.19v - is that normal?
L7030 - 12.59v

should i replace the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: mm 16.19v seems to be normal. just checked on known good board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message:
The resistors are ok, but what about the traces to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

If the fan does not run on full run EFI version of ASD and check sensor issues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message:
i dont see anything wrong with the traces. all traces are clean and have continuity. EFI ASD has passed all the fan and sensor test.


[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i67.tinypic.com/ehn32d.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: Try an SMC reset again it should  at least work. If you do that it should immediately power off or if charging with orange light it should turn green again. So far I have no idea what this could be, the SMC reset issue can maybe provide some clues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: SMC reset doesn't work but Pram reset is working when i do a long press, it doesn't solve the issue. :/

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: Does it work when doing manual reset by shorting <RESISTOR>R5001</RESISTOR> pads?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: oh i didnt know i needed a battery for SMC reset to work. manual set and keyboard smc is working but it still didnt fix the main issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message: I really have no idea at this point. Press on <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and see if it powers on normally. After that try heating the MCP (100C) and see if that helps.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
threads.message:
weird. board seems to fixed it self after i poke around the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> ic with a multimeter. all i did was measuring pin 17 and 16 and press power button at the same time. then next i know was turning on with 1 press power button.

i better change the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> if this was the [B]culprit !! [/B]hope this is a permanent fixed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Pro 15" Late 2008 - turn on when long press on button button.
